Showstopper Pops!

Enjoy an evening of crowd-pleasing favorites from stage and screen. Included are selections from Wicked, West Side Story, James Bond, The Wizard of Oz, The Magnificant Seven, Miss Saigon and more.
With special guests, The Foothills Brass Quintet of Colorado.

Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Contact Phone: 
970-484-7898
Contact Email: 
oldfirehousebooks@gmail.com
Event Website: 
Old Firehouse Book Clubs
Mystery Book Club

If you've ever pictured yourself in a trench coat and fedora, helping knock-out dames and questioning rough characters, then we've got thebook club for you. We'll be revisiting some of the greatest classic mysteries and reading some new takes on the mystery genre as well. Join your fellow mystery lovers for great discussions and figuring outwhodunits.

item.title: The Singing of The Green
item.description:
March 17, 2015
Cost: 
FREE

Location

Opera Galleria
123 North College
Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Organization: 
Anonymous
Event Website: 
http://www.larimerchorale.org/upcoming-concerts

Get your Irish on and celebrate St. Patrick's Day with a free concert!
Guest artists: McTeggart Irish Dance; Jim Ling, bagpiper; Alice Crawford, hammer dulcimer
Once every seven years or so, St. Patrick's Day falls on a Tuesday - the regular rehearsal night for the Chorale. On St. Patrick's Day everyone is a little Irish, so how could we resist putting on the green and singing a concert?!Generously sponsored by the Community Fund of the Community Foundation of Northern Colorado and the Music Event Fund of the Bohemian Foundation.

No

232 Walnut Street
Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Contact Phone: 
970-484-7898
Contact Email: 
oldfirehousebooks@gmail.com
Event Website: 
Old Firehouse Book Clubs
Graphic Novels Book Club

Welcome to our most colorful book club yet!
 
Join us on the THIRD THURSDAY of every month in Happy Lucky's Teahouse, at 6:00 in the evening, to talk about some of our favorite graphic novels. If you have a passion for mixing art and storytelling, or even if you're just plain curious, be sure to stop by and join in on the fun.
As with all our book clubs, our monthly selection is 20% off if you ask for your book club discount in the store.

item.title: Fire Pit Friday
item.description:
March 13, 2015
March 20, 2015
March 27, 2015
Cost: 
Free!

Location

The Biergarten at Anheuser-Busch
2351 Busch Drive
Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Organization: 
The Biergarten at Anheuser-Busch
Contact Phone: 
(970) 490 4691
Contact Email: 
fortcollinsbrewerytour@anehsuer-busch.com
Event Website: 
The Biergarten at Anheuser-Busch Facebook Page

The Biergarten at Anheuser-Busch proudly presents Fire Pit Friday! Come enjoy live music, our beer inspired food, and a wide range of beers from 5-7PM every Friday night in the month of March. S'more kits will be available with a $5 donation going towards the Northern Colorado Red Cross, and you can make them on our fire pits on our patio. Visit our Facebook page or call us at (970) 490-4691 for more information.

No

item.title: Ultimate Pi Day
item.description:
March 21, 2015
Cost: 
FREE

Location

Pateros Creek Brewing
242 N. College Ave
Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Contact Phone: 
970-484-7222
Contact Email: 
localbrew@pateroscreekbrewing.com
Event Website: 
More info on Ultimate Pi Day

All day long we will have free carnival games and FREE PIE. As well as FOUR deliciously PIE FLAVORED BEERS!!! There will be random ways to win free schwag and beer, like pie/pi trivia and pie/pi drawing contest. Plus, anyone wearing our Ultimate Pi Day shirt will receive 20% off pints!
Don’t miss out on the Ultimate Pi Day of a lifetime! See you then!
 
Pi = 3.14.15 9:26:53

No

item.title: The Fly Fishing Film Tour
item.description:
March 21, 2015
Buy Tickets
Cost: 
$15 per person

Location

Lincoln Center
417 W. Magnolia St.
Fort Collins, CO 80524
See map: Google Maps
Organization: 
Anonymous
Event Website: 
http://www.fcgov.com/lctix/show.php?id=698

The original and preeminent exhibition of fly fishing cinema, The F3T is a one of a kind experience. Each year fishy folk of all ages gather at premieres to soak up films from around the world, spin a few yarns amongst friends and dream about casts still unmade. The 2015 tour features 11story-driven films showcasing fly fishing locations, characters and pursuits from around the globe. 

No
